intro: Tapeinosperma cristobalense, commonly known as the Cristobalensis tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem.
